title: NFL: How race-based formulas are interfering with concussion lawsuits
description: The league faces scrutiny over potentially depriving former black players of injury-related payouts.

title: Netflix's Sweet Tooth: 6 things to know about the show
description: The new show is adapted from a comic book series and has been co-produced by Robert Downey Jr.

title: F1's Max Verstappen: 'I have to believe I'm the best'
description: The 23-year-old Dutchman leads Lewis Hamilton in one of the the closest F1 title fights in years.

title: 'We survived, we're resilient and we're back'
description: This is how five centenarians celebrated the reopening of Washington DC nursing homes.

title: Valentina Petrillo: 'Better to be a slow happy woman than a fast unhappy man'
description: If Valentina Petrillo is selected for Italy's squad in Tokyo this year, she will be the first trans woman Paralympian.

title: Oshin: The gritty Japanese drama that gripped the world
description: The 1980s TV show Oshin was a rare Asian global blockbuster that had a lasting cultural impact.

title: How to protect birds and bats from wind turbines
description: As wind farm numbers explode researchers are coming up with more ways to keep wildlife safe.

title: US troops accidentally raid sunflower oil factory
description: They were taking part in a Nato military exercise in Bulgaria but ended up storming the wrong place.

title: The Afghan policewoman facing abuse at work
description: Momena waived her anonymity to talk to the BBC about allegations of abuse in the Afghan Police Force.

title: Lighting a candle for Tiananmen and Hong Kong freedoms
description: A Hong Kong tradition mourning the victims of the 1989 crackdown in Beijing is under threat.

title: Portugal travel list: 'Let us go on holiday and live our lives'
description: UK travellers react with dismay and resignation as quarantine-free travel to Portugal is halted.

title: Mysterious-looking fog hides Chinese island
description: Aerial footage shows Beihuangcheng Island enveloped in advection fog, making buildings almost invisible.

title: Quiz of the week: Olivia Rodrigo, Boris Johnson and a bear fight
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Drivers caught littering on M6 made to pick it up
description: Footage of drivers littering in an emergency area on the M6 is released as part of a campaign.

title: Queen to meet US President Joe Biden next week
description: Mr Biden, visiting the UK for the G7 summit, will be the 12th serving US president to meet Her Majesty.

title: Napier Barracks: Housing migrants at barracks unlawful, court rules
description: Six asylum seekers said Napier Barracks was "unsafe" and dormitory use caused a Covid-19 outbreak.

title: Inter Milan announce Inzaghi as new boss
description: Inter Milan appoint Simone Inzaghi as manager to replace Antonio Conte, who left the club last week.

title: Stranger helps taxi driver from burning car in Welling
description: Taxi driver Abdul Awal did not realise his car was ablaze until a stranger ran over to help him.

title: Fishmongers' Hall: Firearms officer thought he was not going home
description: Usman Khan was confronted by police on London Bridge after killing two Cambridge graduates.

title: Uefa Super Cup game to go ahead in Belfast
description: The Uefa Super Cup match between Chelsea and Villarreal will be played in Belfast on 11 August after suggestions it would be moved to Istanbul.

title: Abortion: Texas teen attacks new law in high school graduation speech
description: Paxton Smith says she couldn't stick to her approved speech script "when there is a war on my body".

title: England v New Zealand: Mark Wood dismisses Henry Nicholls
description: England's Mark Wood claims the first wicket of the day with Ollie Robinson catching Henry Nicholls on day two of the first Test at Lord's.

title: World number one Barty retires from French Open with injury
description: World number one Ashleigh Barty retires with injury from her second-round match against Magda Linette at the French Open.

title: Brixton shooting: Crowds throw objects at police
description: Police were targeted after being called out to investigate the shooting of a man in his 20s.

title: Birmingham stabbing: Man charged with murder of Dea-John Reid
description: Detectives investigating the killing of Dea-John Reid say it is a "significant step forward".

title: Foreign aid: More Conservative rebels join bid to reverse cuts
description: Rebel Tory MPs believe they have enough support to bring spending back to 0.7% of national income.

title: Tesco staff win legal argument in equal pay fight
description: A court ruling brings Tesco shop workers a step closer to gaining equal pay with warehouse staff.

title: Covid-19: UK open-minded on extending furlough says Michael Gove
description: It comes ahead of a Covid summit with Boris Johnson and the first ministers of NI, Scotland and Wales.

title: Vet drowned with dogs after car became stuck in ford
description: An inquest hears Heike Mojay-Sinclare died while driving to a 30th birthday celebration.

title: 'I was so scared of house intruders I went into labour'
description: A woman tells of the terror she felt when thieves broke into her Edinburgh home in the middle of the night.

title: Olympics 100% on - Tokyo 2020 president
description: The Tokyo 2020 president is "100%" certain the Olympics will go ahead, but warns they could be held without fans if there is a coronavirus outbreak.

title: Covid: Prison officers take dogs to work to cut prisoners' stress
description: Prison officers say taking their pets to work helps inmates, as well as reducing tension.

title: The Papers: Children 'let down' and holidays 'under threat'
description: The front pages lead with reaction to school catch-up plans and warnings over Covid's potential impact on travel abroad.
